words.definition: To cherish something means to hold it as very important.
words.example: I cherish this trophy I won.

words.definition: Compassion is a feeling of understanding for someone who is hurt.
words.example: The veterinarian had compassion for the sick little puppy.

words.definition: Consent is permission to do something.
words.example: Their mother gave the children consent to go outside and play.

words.definition: The core is the center of something.
words.example: The rings of a tree start forming at its core.

words.definition: If someone is cunning, they are good at tricking people.
words.example: The cunning fox found a way to steal the chicken.

words.definition: If you feel dizzy, you feel as if you are going to fall down.
words.example: The heat made him feel dizzy.

words.definition: Equilibrium is a state in which different things are balanced.
words.example: The gymnast maintained her equilibrium on the balance beam.

words.definition: To foster something is to help it develop or grow.
words.example: The teacher helped foster a love of reading in her students.

words.definition: To grind something is to break it into very small pieces.
words.example: We use a coffee grinder to grind our own beans.

words.definition: To growl is to make a deep, angry sound like an animal.
words.example: The dog began to growl at the stranger.

words.definition: Moderation is the state of not being extreme.
words.example: It is important to eat sweets in moderation.

words.definition: A predator is an animal that kills and eats other animals.
words.example: The shark is a dangerous predator of the ocean.

words.definition: If someone is sane, they are mentally healthy.
words.example: The doctor determined that the man was sane.

words.definition: A saucer is a small, round plate used for holding a cup.
words.example: She placed the teacup on the saucer.

words.definition: To snatch something is to take it away quickly.
words.example: The bird snatched the piece of bread and flew away.

words.definition: To stagger is to walk unsteadily as if you are about to fall.
words.example: He staggered across the room after being hit in the head.

words.definition: To stumble is to hit your foot on something and almost fall.
words.example: I stumbled over a rock while I was running.

words.definition: If you are tense, you are worried or nervous.
words.example: She felt very tense before her big presentation.

words.definition: To tumble is to fall down suddenly and quickly.
words.example: The vase tumbled off the table and broke into pieces.

words.definition: To withhold something is to refuse to give it.
words.example: The company withheld the information from the public.
